definition[0]: to become quiet and calm, or to make someone quiet and calm
example[0]: Shh! Settle down, please! Now turn to page 57.
example[1]: When Kyle was a baby, we used to take him for rides in the car to settle him down.
definition[1]: to start living a quiet and calm life in one place, especially when you get married
example[2]: They’d like to see their daughter settle down, get married, and have kids.
definition[2]: to start giving all of your attention to a job or activity
example[3]: I sorted out my mail, then settled down to some serious work.
definition[3]: if a situation settles down, it becomes calmer and you are less busy or less worried
example[4]: It’s been really hectic here. When things settle down, I’ll give you a call.
